message.content:
There are several ways to determine if a business is authentic or trustworthy:

1. Research the business: Look up the company's website, read about their history and values, and search for customer feedback online.

2. Verify contact information: Confirm that the company has a phone number, email address, and physical address listed on their website. Then try calling or emailing them to see if there is an actual person responding.

3. Check reviews and ratings: Look for independent reviews from customers who have worked with the company and check any star ratings available on platforms like Google Reviews or Trustpilot.

4. Assess transparency: Authentic businesses will usually display details about their management team, ownership structure, board of directors (if applicable), policies regarding returns/cancellations, privacy policy/terms of service for using their website/app etc., which indicates they've taken time striving seems professional by putting thought into how customers interact with them digitally & in person

5.Remove emotion from decision making process : It’s easy become emotionally invested potential partners – we want believe that someone isn’t ripping off others after all! But protect yourself better trying make more objective assessments relevant factors instead letting gut feelings sway too heavily either direction; this allows weigh both sides more deliberately before forming an opinion based evidence rather than hunches alone
